column1: Marignane is a commune in the Bouches-du-Rhône department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region in southern France.
It is a component of the Aix-Marseille-Provence Metropolis
column2: and the largest suburb of the city of Marseille. It is located 18.3 km (11.4 mi) to the northwest of Marseille.

column1: The climate is hot-summer mediterranean (Köppen: Csa). The city serves as the basis for data from Marseille through the weather station at the airport which is in the city.
In the 15th century the Count of Provence owned the land
column2: and from 1603 to the French Revolution it belonged to the Covets. In the 17th century the Covets refurbished the castle.Three chapels and one convent were built in the 17th and 18th century: Notre-Dame de Pitié (1635)
